comment: tax ID for genus "Ovis", i.e. sheep
tax ID for genus "Capra", i.e. goats and ibex
tax ID for "Canidae", i.e. dogs, wolfs, coyotes and foxes
tax ID for "Felidae", i.e. cats and panthers
tax ID for "Sauria"; this includes birds
tax ID for "Actinopterygii", i.e. ray-finned fishes
refers to breast milk only; note that milk as (processed) food stuff is annotated as "anthropogenic:food:dairy product"
generic term to be used when more specific info is not available
unprocessed wastewater (before reaching the treatment plant)
or hypoxic, <4 mg/L oxygen (but could be 3), see https://www.pnas.org/doi/10.1073/pnas.0803833105
captive animals (eg in a zoo), but not domesticated
subject lives in an urban area (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urban_area)
subject lives in a rural area (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rural_area)
